pageTitle: Brawn might find himself in trouble after Malaysian GP - The Formula 1 News
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {10253=The 27-year-old’s rationale is that, with tyres in good shape and fuel in the tank, he might have been able to chase down the leading Red Bulls. According to Auto Motor und Sport, 1996 world champion Damon Hill agreed: “He might at least have been able to hurry the Red Bulls into a tyre problem.”}
textBeforeTable: Drivers Standings Mark Webber will not quit F1 » Sepang proves that Red Bull are not united–Alonso «  Ross brawn was wrong not to let Nico pass Lewis he is doing the same as he did at Ferrari with Michael, the FIA should put a stop to this fans want to see racing if he does it again they should lose constructors points. He has lost all respect it was only the second race of the season. David tags: Lewis HamiltonMalaysian GPMercedes GPNico RosbergRoss Brawn Print Email
